Posts.Content: Good, and timely advice. Thank you....
Posts.Signature: 71 year old very active and fit. Have been monitoring PSA every six or 12 months for two years after bout of prostatitus. DRE always normal Got tested for BioTee suitability Found an elevated PSA (can't remember what) Got a 12 core biopsy 05 Sept 2018 PSA 5.68 2 positive adenocarcinoma, left 5% 3+4=7 right 50%3+3=6 2 high grade PIN, one R one L 1 suspicious for adenocarcinoma L Stage T1c Grade Group 2 Prolaris score 2.7 Scheduled for Cooled Hydrotherapy Treatment October 11, 2018
Posts.Title: Cooled Thermotherapy Treatment... Why??

Posts.Content: Hey everybody! I'm one of the new guys on the block. I've just been diagnosed with prostate cancer - just three days ago - PSA 5.68, T1c, Gleason 3+4=7, Grade Group 2, Polaris Score 2.7. The first thing the urologist scheduled is CTT, a cooled thermotherapy treatment. Although I have an enlarged prostate, it's not excessive and I generally have no difficulty in urination. So why is this being scheduled? As you can imagine I was in a little of a fog from the unexpected diagnosis at the time, but I seem to remember the doctor saying it would help with the placement of radio active pellets, even though I still haven't selected what type of treatment I'm going to pursue yet. Does any of this make sense to you? I don't seem to see anybody else that had this type of a treatment right out of the gate... I always worry that the medical industry starts making decisions for me based on their revenue stream rather than my health. I'm anxious to learn as much as I can from you guys, and will try and contribute as positively as I can. Still in a bit of a fog... NP
Posts.Title: Cooled Thermotherapy Treatment... Why??

Posts.Content: Thanks guys... I've tried to fill out a signature with my relevant details, but I just don't know much about it yet. I'll learn as I go along, I guess, but right now I'm lost. I'm considering a second opinion but don't know who I can trust. Does anybody know a good urologist in the Fort Worth area of North Texas. I'll drive anywhere within reason if the URO is well recommended... NP

Posts.Title: Cooled Thermotherapy Treatment... Why??

Posts.Content: ASAdvocate, I already figured that part out. But the URO (he does was surprisingly low key, and even said that a lot of guys in my position opted for brachytherapy) recommended an RO that he works with and recommends, and volunteered that they have no commercial relationship. I've checked him out and he seems very experienced. The RO does robot assisted stuff - I don't know if it's da Vinci or not.

Posts.Title: Cooled Thermotherapy Treatment... Why??

Posts.Content: Chuck, I misspoke. I meant to say that the URO does robotic procedures, not the RO. I haven't met the RO yet, but have an appointment set for the 5th of October. I'm trying to set an appointment with Methodist in Houston for a second opinion, even if it's a five hour and thirty minute each way... I've ordered the book. Almost too much information available - I find myself changing my mind with every different article I read. I need to find a knowledgeable professional who does this type of evaluation every day of his life. I'll only do it once. NP
